1.t: (Muhammad), say, "It has been revealed to me that a party of jinn has listened (to the recitation) of the Quran and has told (their people), "We heard an amazing reading
1.tr: Qul oohiya ilaiya annna hustama'a nafarum minal jinni faqaalooo innaa sami'naa quraanan ajaba

2.t: which guides people to the right path and we believe in it. We shall never consider anyone equal to our Lord;
2.tr: Yahdeee ilar rushdi fa-aamannaa bihee Wa-lan nushrika bi-rabbinaaa 'ahada

3.t: our Lord is too exalted to have either a wife or son.
3.tr: Wa-annahoo Ta'aalaa jaddu Rabbinaa maat takhaza saahibatanw Wa-laa walada

4.t: The dimwit one (the devil) among us has been telling confused lies about God.
4.tr: Wa-annahoo kaana yaqoolu safeehunaa 'al allahi shatata

5.t: We thought that no man or jinn could ever tell lies about God.
5.tr: Wa-annaa zanannaaa al lan taqoolal insu wal-jinnu 'al allahi kaziba

6.t: "Certain human beings sought refuge with certain jinn and this increased the rebelliousness of those jinn.
6.tr: Wa-annahoo kaana rijaalun minal insi ya'oozoona bi-rijaalin minal jinni fa-zaadoohum rahaqa

7.t: Those people thought, like you, that God would never send down a Messenger.
7.tr: Wa-annahum zannoo kamaa zanantum al lany yab'asal laahu 'ahada

8.t: "We went near the heavens but found it to be full of strong guards and shooting flames.
8.tr: Wa-annaa lamasnas samaaa'a fa-wajadnaahaa muli'at harasan shadeedanw Wa-shuhuba

9.t: We used to sit near by and try to listen to the heavens, but shooting flames now await those who try to do that.
9.tr: Wa-annaa kunnaa naq'udu minhaa maqaa'ida lis'sam'i famany yastami'il 'aana yajid lahoo shihaabar rasada

10.t: We do not know whether by this arrangement God intends benefit and guidance for the people of the earth or only evil.
10.tr: Wa-annaa laa nadreee asharrun ureeda biman fil ardi 'am 'araada bihim rabbuhum rashada

11.t: As for us, some of us are righteous and others are not. We have all followed different ways.
11.tr: Wa-annaa minnas saalihoona Wa-minnaa doona zaalika kunnaa taraaa'iqa qidada

12.t: We knew that we could never challenge God whether we stayed on earth or fled elsewhere.
12.tr: Wa-annaa zanan-naaa al lan nu'jizal laaha fil ardi Wa-lan nu'jizahoo haraba

13.t: Now that we have listened to the guidance, we believe in it. Whoever believes in his Lord does not need to fear loss or oppression.
13.tr: Wa-annaa lammaa sami'nal hudaaa aamannaa bihee famany yu'min bi-rabbihee falaa yakhaafu bakhsanw Wa-laa rahaqa

14.t: Some of us are Muslims and some of us have deviated from the Truth. Whoever has embraced Islam has followed the right guidance.
14.tr: Wa-annaa minnal muslimoona Wa-minnal qaasitoona faman aslama fa-ulaaa'ika taharraw rashada

15.t: However, the deviators from the Truth will be the fuel for hell".

16.t: Had they (jinn and mankind) remained steadfast in their religion (Islam), We would certainly have given them abundant water to drink
16.tr: Wa-alla-wis taqaamoo 'alat tareeqati la-asqaynaahum maa'an ghadaqa

17.t: as a trial for them. God will make those who disregard the guidance from their Lord suffer increasing torment.
17.tr: Linaftinahum feeh; Wa-many yu'rid 'an zikri rabbihee yasluk-hu 'azaaban sa'ada

18.t: All the parts of the body to be placed on the ground during prostration belong to God.
18.tr: Wa-annal masaajida lil-laahi falaa tad'oo ma'al laahi 'ahada

19.t: Do not prostrate before anyone other than Him. When the servant of God (Muhammad) preached (his message) the jinn would all crowd around him.
19.tr: Wa-annahoo lammaa qaama 'abdul laahi yad'oohu kaadoo yakoonoona 'alaihi libada

20.t: (Muhammad), say, "I worship only my Lord and do not consider anyone equal to Him".
20.tr: Qul innamaaa ad'oo rabbee Wa-laaa ushriku biheee 'ahada

21.t: Say, "I do not possess any power to harm or benefit you".
21.tr: Qul innee laaa amliku lakum darranw Wa-laa rashada

22.t: Say, "No one can protect me from God, nor can I find any place of refuge but with him.
22.tr: Qul innee lany yujeeranee minal laahi 'ahadunw, Wa-lan ajida min doonihee multahada

23.t: My only (means of protection) is to convey the message of God. Whoever disobeys God and His Messenger will go to hell, wherein he will live forever".
23.tr: Illaa balaagham minal laahi Wa-risaalaatih; Wa-many ya'sil laaha Wa-rasoolahoo fa-inna lahoo naara jahannama khaalideena feehaaa 'abada

24.t: (On the Day of Judgment) when the disbelievers witness that with which they have been threatened, they will then know whose helpers are weaker and fewer in number.
24.tr: Hattaaa izaa ra-aw maa yoo'adoona fasaya'lamoona man ad'afu naasiranw Wa-aqallu 'adada

25.t: (Muhammad), say, "I do not know whether that with which you have been threatened is close by or whether my Lord will prolong the time of its coming.
25.tr: Qul in adreee a-qareebum maa too'adoona am yaj'alu lahoo rabbeee 'amada

26.t: He knows the unseen and He does not allow anyone to know His secrets except those of His Messengers whom He chooses.
26.tr: Aalimul ghaibi falaa yuzhiru alaa ghaibiheee 'ahada

27.t: He causes angelic guards to march before and after him.
27.tr: Illaa manir tadaa mir rasoolin fa-innahoo yasluku min baini yadaihi Wa-min khalfihee rasada

28.t: (Messenger) so that He would know that the Messengers have conveyed the message of their Lord. He encompasses all that is with them and He keeps a precise account of all things".
28.tr: Liya'lama an qad ablaghoo risaalaati rabbihim Wa-ahaata bi-maa ladaihim Wa-ahsaa kulla shai'in 'adada
